item.title: WEBJS
item.description: Overview # A WhatsApp API client that connects through the WhatsApp Web browser app. It uses Puppeteer to run a real instance of Whatsapp Web to avoid getting blocked. üëâ WAHA uses WhatsApp WebJS engine by default (if you don’t set WHATSAPP_DEFAULT_ENGINE environment variable to another engine). ‚ö† Read the article before using WEBJS engine How to avoid blocking ->. Run WEBJS # # Core docker run -it -e "WHATSAPP_DEFAULT_ENGINE=WEBJS" devlikeapro/waha # Plus docker run -v `pwd`/.

item.title: NOWEB
item.description: Overview # NOWEB engine does not require a browser to work with WhatsApp Web, it does so directly using a WebSocket. Not running Chromium saves you CPU and Memory, so you can run more instances on a single server! ‚ö† Read the article before using NOWEB engine How to avoid blocking ->. Run NOWEB # # Core docker run -it -e "WHATSAPP_DEFAULT_ENGINE=NOWEB" devlikeapro/waha # Plus docker run -v `pwd`/.sessions:/app/.sessions -e "WHATSAPP_DEFAULT_ENGINE=NOWEB" devlikeapro/waha-plus Links # https://github.

item.title: VENOM
item.description: Overview # ‚ö†Ô∏è ‚ö†Ô∏è ‚ö†Ô∏è DEPRECATED - use WEBJS or NOWEB instead. ‚ö†Ô∏è ‚ö†Ô∏è ‚ö†Ô∏è It’s a high-performance system developed with JavaScript to create a bot for WhatsApp. It uses Puppeteer to run a real instance of Whatsapp Web to avoid getting blocked. ‚ö† Read the article before using VENOM engine How to avoid blocking ->. Run VENOM # # Core docker run -it -e "WHATSAPP_DEFAULT_ENGINE=VENOM" devlikeapro/waha # Plus docker run -v `pwd`/.
